thread.title: Gronk once missed a free throw on purpose to keep the score at 69 (3 photos)
thread.title_full: Gronk once missed a free throw on purpose to keep the score at 69 (3 photos)

author: Alex
title: Gronk once missed a free throw on purpose to keep the score at 69 (3 photos)
text:
View as Slideshow 1 
Gronk was a star basketball player as well as a star football player back in high school, and his greatest moment on the court has finally come to light. 
“So we’re playing a home game and we have 68 points — now, it’s not a blowout, but it’s not a particularly close game either,” said Gronkowski’s high school basketball coach, Chuck Swierski. 
“So (Gronkowski) gets fouled and goes to the free-throw line. He hits the first one to get us to 69 and the place goes nuts because he’s playing into it. On his next free throw, he purposely chucks the ball off the backboard and misses so the score would stay at 69 and then runs back on defense pointing at the scoreboard.” 
That’s right. He purposely missed the free throw to keep the score at 69. 2 GIF 
“This is absolutely juvenile.”— some of you, probably. 
Oooh look at you, Mr. High Brow. I bet you read books and eat dinner that isn’t microwaveable, too. Sitting on your throne of sophistication, looking down on us simpletons as we scratch our cracks and change the channel to Family Guy . I don’t want to associate with anyone who doesn’t at least half-smile at a well-done 69 joke. The “69” joke is like the “send nudes” joke — it will always be funny as long as people keep coming up with new and inventive means of execution. And purposely chucking a brick against the backboard in a basketball game to keep the score at 69 is one for the highlight reel. 
Never change, fellow troglodytes. Never change, Gronk.
